intro: Tieghemopanax cissodendron, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical Africa. It is a woody climbing plant characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe, containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Botanically, it is notable for its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native habitat.
